metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43535 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free could have occured when an HTTP2 session object was released on a different thread, leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 93, Thunderbird < 91.3, and Firefox ESR < 91.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43535` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
